versions.name: Activate SSH key (RSA private key)
versions.description:
Saves the provided **RSA private SSH key** to file
and then loads it into the user's ssh-agent with `ssh-add`.

**The key should not have a passphrase** (should have an empty passphrase).

*Warning: the provided key will overwrite an existing key at
the provided path (if another key at the path already exists).*

It will start the ssh-agent if it can't connect to the agent.

inputs.title: SSH private key in RSA format
(Optional) path to save the private key. Default is: $HOME/.ssh/steplib_ssh_step_id_rsa

(Optional) Remove other, previously loaded keys and restart ssh-agent?
Options: true and false. Default: true.

versions.name: Activate RSA private SSH key
versions.description:
Saves the provided **RSA private SSH key** to file
and then loads it into the user's ssh-agent with `ssh-add`.

**The key should not have a passphrase** (should have an empty passphrase).

*Warning: the provided key will overwrite an existing key at
the provided path (if another key at the path already exists).*

It will start the ssh-agent if it can't connect to the agent.

inputs.title: SSH private key in RSA format
(Optional) path to save the private key. Default is: $HOME/.ssh/steplib_ssh_step_id_rsa

latest.name: Activate SSH key (RSA private key)
latest.description:
Saves the provided **RSA private SSH key** to file
and then loads it into the user's ssh-agent with `ssh-add`.

**The key should not have a passphrase** (should have an empty passphrase).

*Warning: the provided key will overwrite an existing key at
the provided path (if another key at the path already exists).*

It will start the ssh-agent if it can't connect to the agent.

inputs.title: SSH private key in RSA format
(Optional) path to save the private key. Default is: $HOME/.ssh/steplib_ssh_step_id_rsa

(Optional) Remove other, previously loaded keys and restart ssh-agent?
Options: true and false. Default: true.

versions.name: Deploy to Amazon S3
versions.description:
Bitrise Step to Deploy an Xcode archive to Amazon S3.
Required: an Xcode Archive Step should run before this Step!

This Step requires an Amazon S3 registration.
To register an Amazon S3 account, [click here](http://aws.amazon.com/s3/).

inputs.title: BITRISE Archive Step's IPA path output (passed automatically)
BITRISE Archive Step's DSYM output (passed automatically)
BITRISE's App-Slug variable (passed automatically)
BITRISE's Build-Slug variable (passed automatically)
Amazon AWS Access Key
Amazon AWS Secret Access Key
Amazon S3 Bucket Name
Amazon S3 File Path In Bucket (optional, default = bitrise_{app_slug}/{timestamp}_build_{build_slug})

Amazon S3 file access level (optional, default=public_read) possible values:
  * private
  * public_read

outputs.title: Amazon S3 Deploy .plist URL, in a link-ready format (itms-services://?action=download-manifest&url=...)

latest.name: Deploy to Amazon S3
latest.description:
Bitrise Step to Deploy an Xcode archive to Amazon S3.
Required: an Xcode Archive Step should run before this Step!

This Step requires an Amazon S3 registration.
To register an Amazon S3 account, [click here](http://aws.amazon.com/s3/).

inputs.title: BITRISE Archive Step's IPA path output (passed automatically)
BITRISE Archive Step's DSYM output (passed automatically)
BITRISE's App-Slug variable (passed automatically)
BITRISE's Build-Slug variable (passed automatically)
Amazon AWS Access Key
Amazon AWS Secret Access Key
Amazon S3 Bucket Name
Amazon S3 File Path In Bucket (optional, default = bitrise_{app_slug}/{timestamp}_build_{build_slug})

Amazon S3 file access level (optional, default=public_read) possible values:
  * private
  * public_read

outputs.title: Amazon S3 Deploy .plist URL, in a link-ready format (itms-services://?action=download-manifest&url=...)

versions.name: Amazon S3 Bucket Sync
versions.description:
Syncs the given local folder with an S3 bucket.

This Step requires an Amazon S3 registration.
To register an Amazon S3 account, [click here](http://aws.amazon.com/s3/).

# Warning!

It will perform a one-direction sync, removing every file and folder from
the bucket which is not present in the local, input folder!

inputs.title: AWS Access Key
AWS Secret Key
S3 Bucket Name

Local path to upload. If you want to sync only the content of
the folder, but don't want to create the folder then you
should append a slash at the end of the path. Example: ./folder/
Access Control: can be 'public-read' or 'private'. 'private' is the default.

latest.name: Amazon S3 Bucket Sync
latest.description:
Syncs the given local folder with an S3 bucket.

This Step requires an Amazon S3 registration.
To register an Amazon S3 account, [click here](http://aws.amazon.com/s3/).

# Warning!

It will perform a one-direction sync, removing every file and folder from
the bucket which is not present in the local, input folder!

inputs.title: AWS Access Key
AWS Secret Key
S3 Bucket Name

Local path to upload. If you want to sync only the content of
the folder, but don't want to create the folder then you
should append a slash at the end of the path. Example: ./folder/
Access Control: can be 'public-read' or 'private'. 'private' is the default.

versions.name: Dropbox uploader
versions.description:
## Important note:

This Step requires quite a good amount of setup
and is marked for future revision to make it easier to work with.

## Description:

Uploads directory to [Dropbox](https://dropbox.com/).
You have to **authenticate your application** and add the received tokens below.

## Setup instructions:

You can register a Dropbox App [here](https://www.dropbox.com/developers/apps/create).

1. Select the API app option
2. Files and datastores
3. Can your app be limited to its own folder? : Yes or No, choose the one which suites you better.

To get the required tokens you should git clone this repository,
open the Terminal and cd into the folder which contains this file
then run `$ bash dropbox_uploader.sh`.

The script will present a detailed step-by-step guide
you'll have to follow in order to generate the required
API keys and tokens.

It will prompt you to enter your Dropbox App's app keys
which you can get on the *Settings* page of your app
you registered on the [Dropbox Developer site](https://www.dropbox.com/developers/apps).

The *dropbox_uploader.sh* script will present you an authentication URL,
you have to open this URL in your browser and click **Allow**
to grant access.

Once you're finished with the *dropbox_uploader.sh* script
you can get all the required keys and tokens
from the configuration file it generates at *~/.dropbox_uploader*.

To print the content of the configuration file
enter this command into your Terminal: `$ cat ~/.dropbox_uploader`.

## Note about permissions

> One thing to notice is that if you choose "App permission",
> your uploads will end up on Dropbox under an App/<your_app_name> folder.
> To have them stored in another folder, such as in /dir/,
> you'll need to give Dropbox-Uploader permission to all Dropbox files.

You can find more information at [Dropbox-Uploader](https://github.com/andreafabrizi/Dropbox-Uploader).

inputs.title: App Key
App Secret
Access Level: sandbox or dropbox. Sandbox is more secure, it only allows upload to the App's folder.
OAuth access token
OAuth access token secret
Local path to upload
Path on Dropbox

versions.name: FTP Upload
versions.description: Upload a single file or a folder (recursively) to an FTP server.

inputs.title: Host of the target FTP (example: ftp.someserver.com)
Username
Password

The source (local) file or directory for the FTP upload.
Format examples: "$HOME/temp" or "$HOME/temp/")

The target (remote) path for the FTP upload.
Target is handled as directory if ends with "/", file otherwise.
Format examples: "$HOME/temp" or "$HOME/temp/"; default is / (root)

latest.name: FTP Upload
latest.description: Upload a single file or a folder (recursively) to an FTP server.

inputs.title: Host of the target FTP (example: ftp.someserver.com)
Username
Password

The source (local) file or directory for the FTP upload.
Format examples: "$HOME/temp" or "$HOME/temp/")

The target (remote) path for the FTP upload.
Target is handled as directory if ends with "/", file otherwise.
Format examples: "$HOME/temp" or "$HOME/temp/"; default is / (root)

versions.name: Git Clone Repository
versions.description:
Clones a repository based on the provided inputs.

**NOTE**: it will remove the specified (local) Destination Directory before cloning!

If a git commit is provided it will ignore the tag and branch parameters.
If no git commit but a tag is provided then it will ignore the branch parameter.

Auth: if SSH private key parameter provided the other auth parameters will be ignored.

Use either the *(raw) SSH* or the *Base64 encoded SSH* key input to specify
the SSH key. If both specified the *(raw) SSH* key input will be used.

inputs.title: Git repository URL
Git Commit to clone
Git Tag to clone
Git Branch to clone
Clone destination (local) directory path
Auth: Username
Auth: Password
Auth: SSH private key - without a passphrase!
Auth: Base64 (strict - RFC 4648) encoded SSH private key - without a passphrase!
[optional] Generate a Formatted (markdown) output file to this path
[optional] Is export outputs. Set it to true to allow the export of the outputs. Default is false.

outputs.title: Cloned git commit's author email address

versions.name: Send HipChat message
versions.description:
Send a HipChat message to a room.

This Step requires a HipChat account.
To sign up on HipChat for free, [click here](https://www.hipchat.com/sign_up).

You can get your HipChat auth token
in **Account settings > API access**.
*If you do not have an auth token, select Create token*, at the bottom.

You can get the *room id* of any HipChat room by selecting *Rooms > Summary > API ID*.

inputs.title: HipChat Auth Token
HipChat RoomID
From Name (max 15 characters)

Message Color - options:

 * yellow (default)
 * red
 * green
 * purple
 * gray
 * random
Message

versions.name: HockeyApp Deploy
versions.description:
Bitrise step to deploy an iOS application to HockeyApp.

Register a HockeyApp account at [http://hockeyapp.net/](http://hockeyapp.net/)
and create an app to utilize this step.
You also need to create a *HockeyApp Token* for your app.

inputs.title: Token to access the HockeyApp application (note that different access types exist when obtaining a token on your account page)
Identifier of the HockeyApp application
(optional) Additional notes to the deploy. default = "Automatic build with Bitrise."
(optional) Notes type. Possible values: 0 - Textile (default), 1 - Markdown
(optional) Sets who should be notified on deployment. Requires full-access tokens. Possible values: 0 - no testers, 1 - all testers that can install this app, 2 - all testers (default)
(optional) Download status. Requires full-access tokens. Possible values: 1 - not allow users to download the version, 2 - make the version available for download. (default)
(optional) Set if version is mandatory to install. 0 - not mandatory (default), 1 - mandatory
(optional) Restrict download to comma-separated list of tags
(optional) Git commit sha for this build
(optional) Set to the URL of the build job on your build server
(optional) Set to your source repository

outputs.title: Public URL of the newly deployed version
URL of the HockeyApp config view

latest.name: HockeyApp Deploy
latest.description:
Bitrise step to deploy an iOS application to HockeyApp.

Register a HockeyApp account at [http://hockeyapp.net/](http://hockeyapp.net/)
and create an app to utilize this step.
You also need to create a *HockeyApp Token* for your app.

inputs.title: Token to access the HockeyApp application (note that different access types exist when obtaining a token on your account page)
Identifier of the HockeyApp application
(optional) Additional notes to the deploy. default = "Automatic build with Bitrise."
(optional) Notes type. Possible values: 0 - Textile (default), 1 - Markdown
(optional) Sets who should be notified on deployment. Requires full-access tokens. Possible values: 0 - no testers, 1 - all testers that can install this app, 2 - all testers (default)
(optional) Download status. Requires full-access tokens. Possible values: 1 - not allow users to download the version, 2 - make the version available for download. (default)
(optional) Set if version is mandatory to install. 0 - not mandatory (default), 1 - mandatory
(optional) Restrict download to comma-separated list of tags
(optional) Git commit sha for this build
(optional) Set to the URL of the build job on your build server
(optional) Set to your source repository

outputs.title: Public URL of the newly deployed version
URL of the HockeyApp config view

versions.name: Send Email with Mailgun
versions.description:
Send email with Mailgun ( [https://mailgun.com](https://mailgun.com) ).

With the free Mailgun account you can send 10,000 emails/month, 300 emails/day.

inputs.title: Mailgun API Key
Mailgun Domain
Send To emails (comma separated email address list)
Email Subject
Email Message (can be HTML)

Send To emails (comma separated email address list)

versions.name: Secure Delete a given path (OS X)
versions.description:
Calls `rm -rfP the-path` to securely delete the given file or folder.

From the OS X [rm man documentation](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/Reference/Manpages/man1/rm.1.html):

    Option -P: Overwrite regular files before deleting them. Files are overwritten three times, first
    with the byte pattern 0xff, then 0x00, and then 0xff again, before they are deleted.

inputs.title: File or Folder path to delete.

Use sudo for delete? Options:
  * true (default): use sudo
  * false: don't use sudo

latest.name: Secure Delete a given path (OS X)
latest.description:
Calls `rm -rfP the-path` to securely delete the given file or folder.

From the OS X [rm man documentation](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/Reference/Manpages/man1/rm.1.html):

    Option -P: Overwrite regular files before deleting them. Files are overwritten three times, first
    with the byte pattern 0xff, then 0x00, and then 0xff again, before they are deleted.

inputs.title: File or Folder path to delete.

Use sudo for delete? Options:
  * true (default): use sudo
  * false: don't use sudo

versions.name: Send Push Notification with Parse
versions.description:
Send a push notification with [Parse](https://parse.com/).

To use their service you have to register first.
It is possible to register a trial account for free.

You can get the required keys and IDs from your parse app's page,
similar to this: [https://www.parse.com/apps/your-parse-apps-name/edit#app_keys](https://www.parse.com/apps/your-parse-apps-name/edit#app_keys)

You have to install your own Push Receiver app to receive the push notifications - you can find a
template app here: [https://github.com/bitrise-io/example-parse-notification-center-ios-app](https://github.com/bitrise-io/example-parse-notification-center-ios-app)

inputs.title: Parse App ID
Parse REST API Key
The text of the push message (optional, default is "Automatic build with Bitrise.")

latest.name: Send Push Notification with Parse
latest.description:
Send a push notification with [Parse](https://parse.com/).

To use their service you have to register first.
It is possible to register a trial account for free.

You can get the required keys and IDs from your parse app's page,
similar to this: [https://www.parse.com/apps/your-parse-apps-name/edit#app_keys](https://www.parse.com/apps/your-parse-apps-name/edit#app_keys)

You have to install your own Push Receiver app to receive the push notifications - you can find a
template app here: [https://github.com/bitrise-io/example-parse-notification-center-ios-app](https://github.com/bitrise-io/example-parse-notification-center-ios-app)

inputs.title: Parse App ID
Parse REST API Key
The text of the push message (optional, default is "Automatic build with Bitrise.")

versions.name: Random Quote
versions.description:
Prints a random quote and saves it into the `$RANDOM_QUOTE`
environment variable (appends to the *~/.bash_profile*).

Uses the [http://www.iheartquotes.com](http://www.iheartquotes.com) API.

environment variable (appends to the *~/.bash_profile*).

Uses the [http://www.iheartquotes.com](http://www.iheartquotes.com) API.

versions.name: Set Environment Variable
versions.description:
Define an Environment Variable, key and it's value for the upcoming Steps.

*The Environment Variable will be added to a profile file, to make it available
for other steps. Default is ~/.bash_profile*

inputs.title: Environment Variable Key - without a dollar sign ($), just the name of the key, without spaces. All caps is recommended but not required). Example: MY_VAR.
Value - this will replace the key when you use the key with a leading dollar sign ($)
(optional, default: $HOME/.bash_profile) Profile File path, the Env variable will be appended into

versions.name: Set Environment Variable
versions.description:
Define an Environment Variable, key and it's value for the upcoming Steps.
*Appends the environment variable into ~/.bash_profile*

inputs.title:
Environment Variable Key - without a dollar sign ($), just the name of the key, without spaces.
(All caps is recommended but not required).

Example: MY_VAR.
Value - this will replace the key when you use the key with a leading dollar sign ($)

latest.name: Set Environment Variable
latest.description:
Define an Environment Variable, key and it's value for the upcoming Steps.

*The Environment Variable will be added to a profile file, to make it available
for other steps. Default is ~/.bash_profile*

inputs.title: Environment Variable Key - without a dollar sign ($), just the name of the key, without spaces. All caps is recommended but not required). Example: MY_VAR.
Value - this will replace the key when you use the key with a leading dollar sign ($)
(optional, default: $HOME/.bash_profile) Profile File path, the Env variable will be appended into

versions.name: Send Slack message
versions.description:
Send a [Slack](https://slack.com/) message to a channel or group.

You have to register an *Incoming WebHook integration* at:
**https://YOURTEAMNAME.slack.com/services**

On the WebHook integration's page check the *Setup Instructions*
and copy the URL from the cURL example.
The Webhook URL should look like this:
**https://YOURTEAMNAME.slack.com/services/hooks/WEBHOOKNAME?token=HOOKTOKEN**

inputs.title: Slack Webhook URL
Target Slack channel (ex: #general), group name or username (prefix it with @, for example: @myusername)
The 'from' name: the one which should be presented as the sender of the message
The message you want to send.

versions.name: Step Tester and Validator Step
versions.description:
Validates the Step Repository and runs the Step.

* Checks for Required and Recommended files in the specified Step repository
* Runs the Step with the given parameters
* Validates that the Step can run without problems
* Prints Validation summary and the Step's formatted output (if any)

inputs.title: Step Repository URL (public GitHub repository URL, example: https://github.com/bitrise-io/steps-step-tester-and-validator.git)
Step Version (git tag in the repository! Example: 1.0.0)

[TEST] Branch of the Repository - use it only for testing! Real Step repositories should use version tags instead of branch! Note: this parameter is only used if no Tag is specified (leave the Tag input empty)!
Step's Inputs, one input per line in the format: key=the value, anything until newline

versions.name: TestFlight Deploy
versions.description:
Bitrise step to deploy an iOS application to TestFlight.

You need to register an account on TestFlight's [website](https://www.testflightapp.com).

You also have to create the required tokens:

* TestFlight API Token : on your **account page**, **Upload API** section. 
* Team Token: Click on your *app's team name* in the upper-right corner, edit info, and there is your **Team Token**.

inputs.title: Token to allow uploads via the API
Token to access the Team where you will deploy to
(optional) Additional notes to the deploy. default = "Automatic build with Bitrise."
(optional) Sets if a notification should be sent of the deployment. True / False (default)
(optional) Sets if this deploy should replace the previous one. True / False (default)
(optional) Distribution list

outputs.title: Public URL of the newly deployed version

outputs.title: Public URL of the newly deployed version

versions.name: Twilio SMS Text Message Sender
versions.description:
SMS Text Message Sender using [https://www.twilio.com/](https://www.twilio.com/)

To use their service you have to register first.
It is possible to register a trial account for free.

Important! [Info about resipient charging](https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/sms/when-i-send-an-sms-message-through-twilio-does-the-recipient-of-my-sms-message-get-charged)

inputs.title: Twilio Account SID
Twilio account authentication token
Twilio SMS From number
Send SMS To number (only one allowed)
SMS message

latest.description:

versions.name: Xcode Builder
versions.description: Performs Xcode build, test, analyze or archive action, based on it's input.

inputs.title: Project file path (.xcodeproj or .xcworkspace), relative to the repository root.
Scheme in the Project to build
Action Build: set it to 'true' to perform Xcode 'build' action
Action Analyze: set it to 'true' to perform Xcode 'analyze' action
Action Archive: set it to 'true' to perform Xcode 'archive' action
Action UnitTest: set it to 'true' to perform Xcode 'test' action
Certificate URL
Certificate Passphrase
Provisioning Profile URL
Build Tool: "xcodebuild" is the default; "xctool" is supported; BITRISE_ACTION_ARCHIVE and BITRISE_ACTION_UNITTEST can only use "xcodebuild"
(Optional) Xcode Version to use. Default is "6".

[UNITTEST] Device to run the tests with, will be appended to the "platform=iOS Simulator,name=" `-destination` flag of the xcodebuild command. Default is "iPad". For other simulator devices set it as it is shown in Xcode's device selection dropdown UI.
